noun.description: With singular concord: the body of technical terms or methods in a particular field; technics, technique. Treated as plural: a technical term or method, a technique.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Charles Burney (1726–1814), musician and author. Partly from ancient Greek τεχνικά, neuter plural of τεχνικός, and partly from ancient Greek τεχνική, feminine singular of τεχνικός, after Latin feminine nouns in -a.
